description: Erection of a single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: Please provide revised copies of existing and proposed plans/elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.Please note that the drawings submitted do not scale and does not show the scale used.

The proposed extensions and alterations are considered to fall within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015.

The scheme is considered to be inappropriate development in an area at risk of flooding and it has not been demonstrated the development would be made safe for its lifetime without increasing flood risk elsewhere.Moreover, It is considered that the Flood Risk Assessment fails to demonstrate that the development would not have an adverse impact on the risk of flooding both off and on site. In addition, the submitted Flood Risk Assessment does not follow the Guidance set out in the NPPG and as such has recived an objection from the Environment Agency.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate works to maintain a large tree in close proximity to the main dwelling.Recommendation:Approve.
